definition: to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

pinyin: shen1 shou3 bu4 jian4 wu3 zhi3

sentences.english: She extends a helping hand to the poor and opens her arms to the needy.
sentences.chinese: 她张手赒济困苦人，伸手帮助穷乏人。

sentences.english: Surprisingly, after chewing it for a bit, he found it sweetish and rather pleasant.
sentences.chinese: 当下伸手接过，咬了一口，咀嚼之下，倒也甘美可口。

sentences.english: Oh, she said with an overly dramatic hit to her forehead.
sentences.chinese: 哦，她极富戏剧性地伸手拍一下额头，说。

sentences.english: A true friend is someone who reaches for your hand and touches your heart.
sentences.chinese: 一个真正的朋友是向著你伸手，触动你心灵的人。

sentences.english: I stood and smiled and offered Jeanine a handshake.
sentences.chinese: 我笑着站了起来，并伸手出去和珍妮握手告别。

sentences.english: Egypt's clean water had been sullied with blood by the hand of the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 那时，上帝伸手让埃及的干净水变成血。

sentences.english: On tiptoes I reached up and opened the heavy door.
sentences.chinese: 我踮起脚尖伸手摸索着打开了它厚重的门。

sentences.english: Said to stretch hand to point to be hugged by the wet nurse looking at in the bosom book sleet goes fishing of Hong Tun.
sentences.chinese: 说着伸手指了被乳母抱在怀里看着书雪钓鱼的弘暾。

sentences.english: Then she reached into her handbag and took out her ATM card.
sentences.chinese: 然后她伸手到她手提包里拿出她的银行卡。

sentences.english: He dug into the can and measured out a small spoonful of the powder .
sentences.chinese: 他伸手到罐头里舀出一小调羹白粉。

sentences.english: He was reaching for my poem.
sentences.chinese: 说着他就伸手去拿我那一首诗。

sentences.english: Neil: And she couldn't see her hand in front of her.
sentences.chinese: 她说烟雾大得她伸手都不见五指。

sentences.english: He reached down the atlas from the top shelf .
sentences.chinese: 他伸手将地图册从顶屋书架上取下。

sentences.english: Then, reaching under his pillow, he pulled out some more crumpled up bills.
sentences.chinese: 然后，他伸手到枕头下摸出几张皱皱巴巴的钞票。

sentences.english: Lingheng sound of a hand put fireballs fly.
sentences.chinese: 我冷哼一声，伸手便把火球打飞。

sentences.english: I let go of her hand and she reached out to touch a pair of shiny black shoes with a strap and silver buckle.
sentences.chinese: 我松开她的手，她伸手去够一双银搭扣的光面黑鞋。

definition: to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to adopt an attitude/to strike a posture
